description: [The Conversation Africa] Finding bats is hard. They are small, fast and they primarily fly at night.
title: Africa: Maths Makes Finding Bat Roosts Much Easier, Our Research Shows

description: [Global Press Journal] Wakiso, Uganda -- Providing sexual and gender minorities with secure places to live has become more fraught since the passage of an anti-homosexuality law.
title: Africa: A Network of Hope - Shelters in Uganda Unite to Safely House LGBTQ People

description: [Nile Post] The Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD), through its Agriculture and Environment Division, has intensified efforts to prioritize key areas of intervention to boost food systems resilience in the livestock sector, particularly in pastoral areas.
title: Africa: IGAD Scales Up Efforts to Enhance Food System Resilience

description: [Africa Check] Scam alert! UN children's agency Unicef not running promotions or offering loans on Facebook
title: Africa: Scam Alert! UN Children's Agency Unicef Not Running Promotions or Offering Loans On Facebook

description: [Africa Check] Misleading to claim shipping regulations that cut sulphur emissions and increased temperatures disprove human-caused global warming
title: Africa: Misleading to Claim Shipping Regulations That Cut Sulphur Emissions and Increased Temperatures Disprove Human-Caused Global Warming

description: [ISS] As Moscow makes gains through bilateral deals, African states must avoid getting drawn into a global proxy conflict.
title: Africa: Russia's Growing Influence in Africa Calls for More Balanced Partnerships

description: [The Conversation Africa] Imagine a future where your phone pings with a message that your dead father's "digital immortal" bot is ready. This promise of chatting with a virtual version of your loved one - perhaps through a virtual reality (VR) headset - is like stepping into a sci-fi movie, both thrilling and a bit eerie.
title: Africa: An Eerie 'Digital Afterlife' Is No Longer Science Fiction. So How Do We Navigate the Risks?

description: [The Conversation Africa] The emergence of Long COVID as a mysterious new illness has refocused attention on the incapacitating nature of persistent fatigue.
title: Africa: Success in Treating Persistent Pain Now Offers Hope for Those With Long Covid

description: [ISS] Africa's productive blue carbon ecosystems offer climate mitigation solutions, but countries must guard against the exploitation of local communities.
title: Africa: Blue Carbon Markets - Africa Must Carefully Balance Risks and Rewards

description: [The Conversation Africa] You may have seen headlines that link social media to sadness and depression. Social media use goes up, happiness goes down. But recent studies suggest those findings might not be so straightforward.
title: Africa: Is Social Media Making You Unhappy? the Answer Is Not So Simple
